General.q: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
General.facts:
Why Mars looks red

  • Rusty dust: Mars is covered in iron-rich dust that has oxidised, giving the surface a red appearance.
  • Thin atmosphere: Its atmosphere is too thin to hide the surface colour.
  • Nicknames: Because of its colour, many cultures associate Mars with war or fire.

General.q: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
General.facts:
The vast Pacific

  • Sheer size: It covers more than 30% of the Earth's surface.
  • Deepest point: The Mariana Trench, over 11,000 metres deep, lies in the Pacific.
  • Ring of Fire: Many of the world's volcanoes and earthquakes occur around its edges.

General.q: In chess, which piece moves in an L-shape?
General.facts:
The tricky knight

  • Unique move: The knight moves two squares in one direction and then one at a right angle.
  • Jumping: It is the only piece that can jump over other pieces.
  • Forks: Knights are excellent at forking two or more pieces at once.

Movies.q: Who directed the sci‑fi heist movie Inception?
Movies.facts:
Christopher Nolan

  • Mind‑bending style: Known for complex narratives and practical effects.
  • Other hits: Directed The Dark Knight trilogy, Interstellar and Oppenheimer.
  • Sound & visuals: Often collaborates with composer Hans Zimmer and cinematographer Hoyte van Hoytema.

Movies.q: Which movie popularised the phrase “May the Force be with you”?
Movies.facts:
The Force is strong

  • First appearance: The line was spoken in the 1977 film Star Wars: A New Hope.
  • Cultural impact: It has become a universal way to wish someone good luck.
  • May the 4th: Fans celebrate “Star Wars Day” on May 4th because it sounds like the phrase.

Movies.q: In the Marvel Cinematic Universe, what is the name of Thor’s hammer?
Movies.facts:
Mjölnir

  • Worthiness: Only those who are deemed worthy can lift the hammer.
  • Origins: Based on the hammer from Norse mythology.
  • On screen: Appears in multiple films, including Thor, The Avengers, and Avengers: Endgame.

Music.q: Which musical instrument has 88 keys on a standard modern version?
Music.facts:
The modern piano

  • Key count: 52 white keys and 36 black keys.
  • Origins: Developed from earlier keyboard instruments like the harpsichord.
  • Range: Covers more than seven octaves, making it one of the most versatile instruments.

Music.q: Which pop star is known as the ‘King of Pop’?
Music.facts:
Michael Jackson

  • Iconic albums: Thriller, Bad, and Off the Wall.
  • Record‑breaking: Thriller is one of the best‑selling albums of all time.
  • Signature moves: Famous for the moonwalk and gravity‑defying lean.
